resources.string: Download of data in progress…\nPlease try again in a few seconds or check your internet connection.
Future log dates are not allowed.
The logbook of this cache is empty.
This geocacher reported that there is a problem with this cache.
This geocacher reported that the logbook is full.
This geocacher reported that the container is damaged.
This geocacher reported that the cache might be missing.
This geocacher reported that there is a problem with this cache.
This geocacher reported that this geocache should be archived. A community volunteer reviewer has been notified.
Translation may fail with a large amount of text.
Captcha required. Please refer to our FAQ for guidance.
Unable to contact Geocaching.com. The website may be down or your internet connection not working.
Unable to contact Extremcaching.com. The website may be down or your internet connection not working.
Unable to contact labs.geocaching.com. The website may be down or your internet connection not working.
Unable to contact Geocaching.su. The website may be down or your internet connection not working.
Unable to contact GeoKrety.org. The website may be down or your internet connection not working.
c:geo can\'t log in. c:geo works offline with Stored caches. Check Login settings or enable your internet connection.
Unknown error. Please refer to our FAQ for guidance.
c:geo was unable to map this address to an existing location
Unknown communication error. Please refer to our FAQ for guidance.
Geocaching.com is down for maintenance. c:geo works offline with Stored caches.
You have not agreed to the Geocaching.com license agreement, so c:geo can\'t load cache coordinates.
You must validate your account on the Geocaching.com website first.
The requested cache could not be found.
This Cache is only available to Geocaching.com Premium Members.
c:geo can\'t display the geocache you want. Is it really a geocache?
c:geo found no spoiler images for this cache.
This cache is only available to premium members of geocaching.com. Therefore, the cache information cannot be displayed.\n\nHowever, if you have already found this cache, you can log it here.
c:geo can\'t find any suitable application.
c:geo failed to initialize authorization process.
c:geo is unable to log your visit. Please log your visit from the full cache details screen.
c:geo failed to download cache details.
c:geo doesn\'t know location of cache.
Please enter a device name before registering.
Selecting an image for the log failed.
c:geo can\'t display the trackable you want. Is it really a trackable?
c:geo doesn\'t know to which cache you want to add a waypoint for.
c:geo failed to add your waypoint.
Fill both bearing and distance. Bearing is angle 0 to 360 degrees relative to north. Distance doesn\'t require units.
c:geo can\'t load data required to log visit.
It seems that your log was not posted. Please check it on the cache originating website.
It seems that your log was not posted. Please check it on Extremcaching.com.
It seems that your log was not posted. Please check it on GeoKrety.org.
It seems that your log image was not uploaded. Please check it on the cache originating website.
c:geo can\'t parse latitude or longitude.
Could not load the selected render theme. Reverting to the built-in one.
The selected render theme is not valid for this mapsforge version. Reverting to the built-in one.
There is nothing to be saved.
There are no caches with coordinates.
No currently activated geocaching services provide this type of search.
Enter an address or location name. For example use a postal address \"Radlicka 100, Prague, Czech Republic\", a city name \"Berlin\" or just a name of something like \"Yellowstone Park\".
Enter the code for a geocache. For example \"GC1VCAZ\".
Enter all or part of a geocache\'s name. For example \"Night Cache\".
Enter the code for a trackable. For example \"TB29QMZ\".
Please input some text for your log.
Character must be a LETTER or a DIGIT
Not logged in. Live map will only show caches stored locally. Tap here for more information.

Not logged in (yet). Live map will only show caches stored locally and online functions will not work.

Either there is no network connection, a server problem or you have to (re)configure your geocaching services.

Do you want to configure services now?
Type of log has been changed!
Image selection or capture was cancelled.
The cache has been stored locally
Be sure to save waypoint if you want to keep the calculator state.

You have some caches with an offline saved log, which might not yet be logged online. For your comfort the count of these logs is displayed as "+ x" behind your number of found caches in the footer at c:geo's main page. 

Moreover these "x" logs will be added to the "NUMBER" template you might use in your log signature. 

If you don't like this counter extension, you can disable it under "Settings" > "Logging" and/or use the "NUMBER (without offline logs)" template instead. 

To easily find remaining offline logs, go to the list "History" and filter for "With personal data" > "With offline log".
Logging %1$s from c:geo cannot be done anonymously. Do you want to open the settings to fill in your credentials from %2$s?
Sorry, cannot find a suitable preference screen.
c:geo failed to get cache popup info.
c:geo failed to load additional data (trackables/favorite points) for logging.
Your Google Play Service is outdated. Do you want to switch to Mapsforge map provider instead?
Default map switched to Mapsforge map provider. Restart your map now.
c:geo can scan geocodes which are printed as QR code. The necessary app is not installed. Do you want to open Google Play to install it?
Didn\'t find any geocodes in the scan result.
Do you want to upload modified coordinates for all (selected) caches and overwrite the existing coordinates on the server? This cannot be undone.

This will overwrite the existing coordinates on the server for all (selected) caches of your list with the current listing coordinates in c:geo! This is to be used only in special cases, e. g. when you imported a GPX file which contains corrected coordinates as listing coordinates. This cannot be undone and you should only use it, if you know what you are doing. In normal cases you might rather want to use the function \"Upload modified coordinates\" in the same menu.
Do you want to clear the offline logs?
Your Android version does not support automatic detection of icons supported - some characters may be missing
c:geo failed to create the new list
Do you want to remove the current list? All caches remaining in the list will be moved to \"Stored\".
List is empty. Do you want to remove the current list?
Do not ask me again for this list
List no longer available, switching to standard list
Changing to \'Basic\' mode will result in loss of filter settings. Do you want to continue?
Whether to include cache in result when a filter needs info on cache which is not available.
Tap \'Add filter criteria\' above to add a filter
Load or delete an existing filter
Do you really want to delete this filter config?
Select filter or clear current filter
A filter with name \'%s\' and different configuration already exists. Overwrite it?

With option \'Pattern\', use wildcards * and ?. * represents zero, one or multiple characters, ? represents one single character. For example, pattern \'H?mburg*\' will match e.g. \'Homburg\' or \'Hamburg at Night\' but not \'A day in Hamburg\' or \'Hahmburg\'
This filter setting will only affect mystery caches.\n\n A mystery is considered \'solved\' if it has either changed coordinates or a valid final waypoint filled with coordinates.
System Information is collected, please wait…
Please include the following system information when sending a bug report or asking for more information about c:geo:

Create standard or extended logfile?

Standard logfiles will be fine for most use cases.
Use extended logfiles only when asked to do so.

- all our translation contributors on [Crowdin.net](https://crowdin.net/project/cgeo)!
- all issue creators
- and all other supporters.
An unexpected problem has occured which we would request you to report to us:

Help us fixing c:geo problems by reporting them via email with system information and c:geo logfile included.
Please do always also include a detailed error description with your mail!

Before sending a mail please also check our FAQ and/or social media presence for known problems.
Other contact options can be found at 'About c:geo'
Configure user account information and access to optional services.
Configure distance units, language and app colors.
Customize the display of cache information.
Configure the data to be saved for offline use, the storage location and folders for GPX files.
Configure your signature and set logging options.
Set map source, offline map settings and map details.
Offline routing is available if either helper app \"BRouter\" is installed and configured or internal routing is enabled.
Moving the geocache data might take a really long time, depending on your device and the amount of data.
Configure offline routing, choose preferred navigation methods and select external navigation apps.
System specific settings and debugging options.
With using the service of geocaching.com, you accept the Groundspeak Terms of Use.
You can\'t make c:geo login to geocaching.com with your Facebook or Google account. But there is a simple workaround…
Authorize c:geo with geocaching.com to search for caches.
Authorize c:geo with extremcaching.com to search for caches and access/filter your found caches.
Authorize c:geo with geocaching.su to search for caches.

Include Adventure Lab caches on the map.

(Available to "Geocaching.com" premium members only. Requires an activated "Geocaching.com" service.)

Changing this setting requires a restart.

This is a geocaching.com Adventure Lab Cache. Adventures can only be played with the Groundspeak Adventure Lab App. Tap on the Adventure Lab icon on the \"Details\" page to open/install the Adventure Lab App for this adventure from there.\nIf you don\'t want to see Adenture Lab caches on your map and search, you can deactivate using the \"settings\" menu - Services - Geocaching.com Adventure Lab
Authorize c:geo with opencaching.de to search for caches and access/filter your found caches.
Authorize c:geo with opencaching.pl to search for caches and access/filter your found caches.
Authorize c:geo with opencaching.nl to search for caches and access/filter your found caches.
Authorize c:geo with opencaching.us to search for caches and access/filter your found caches.
Authorize c:geo with opencaching.ro to search for caches and access/filter your found caches.
Authorize c:geo with opencache.uk to search for caches and access/filter your found caches.
To be able to rate a cache, you need to follow the instructions at GCVote.com and enter your GCVote password here.
Local time invalid, adjust device time
This app seems not to be installed
Placeholder strings - like [NAME] - are filled with the designated text when the template is used.
Display additional logbook page for friends\' and own logs
Open details with last used page
Show address instead of coordinates on main screen
If less than the given amount of caches are displayed on the map, their waypoints are shown additionally.
If mapping a single cache: Should zoom be adjusted to include all its waypoints?
Maximum distance up to which offline routing will calculate a route.
Automatically offer to download missing routing tile data.
Automatically check for update of map and theme files. (Valid only for files you have downloaded with the integrated downloader.)
Open BRouter to download missing routing data (%s)
If routing is active: Show the straight distance in addition to the calculated route length.
Use c:geo internal routing to be able to use automatic routing data downloading and other functions
If enabled big emoticons will be shown for logged caches on the map instead of the cache type icon (requires restart).
Globally disable waypoint extraction from personal cache notes. It can still be enabled for individual caches by deactivating the checkbox below the personal cache note
External websites will be displayed without leaving c:geo (only possible if Chrome is installed)
Use Imperial Units instead of Metric Units
Enable Offline Logging (Won\'t show online log screen when logging, won\'t upload logs)
Ask which list to store caches in
Maximum number of caches to load from database initially when displaying stored lists. Choose 0 for \'unlimited\'
Show membership of caches to additional lists in a cache list
Show an arrow with compass direction for caches in a list

Please note that this feature can backup caches, waypoints & settings, but no cache images. \nIn order to be able to restore the data even after losing your phone, the backup files should be copied to an independent location.
This will store your entered login credentials within the backup.
Please select the folder that contains the backup you want to restore
Decide how many backups should be kept. When the limit is reached, the oldest ones will be deleted automatically.
You have saved more backups than your configured maximum value allows. Do you really want to remove all excess backups?
c:geo\'s database was successfully copied to:
Database is empty, no backup necessary. Still create a backup?
Unable to create a new backup folder. Did you already perform a backup in the last minute?
There is no backup file available.
This will delete your oldest existing backup folder from %s. \nDo you want to continue?
WARNING: This will overwrite %s on your device!
WARNING: This will overwrite %s and your current settings on your device!
WARNING: This will overwrite your current settings on your device!
Please select what you want to restore:
Restoration failed: Backup file corrupt, database had to be recreated.
Restoration of the database has failed.
Restoration of program settings has failed.
Database is empty. Do you want to restore the database backup?
There is no file with a backup.

Unexpected format - cannot restore database.

Expected version is %1$d,
backup has version %2$d
Perform backup and restore of cache/waypoint data and program settings.
Do you want to store sensitive account related data? Those may be readable by other applications.
c:geo needs to be restarted now to bring loaded settings into effect

Folder "%1$s" will be changed to "%2$s" during restoration.

Tap "%4$s" to proceed. In that case you will be asked to regrant c:geo access to that folder.

Tap "%3$s" to keep the current folder setting instead.

"%1$s" will be changed to "%2$s" during restoration.

Tap "%4$s" to proceed. In that case you will be asked to regrant c:geo access to that file.

Tap "%3$s" to keep the current setting instead.

c:geo supports maps for offline use. You can obtain maps from different providers or even create your own maps (from OSM data). First you have to select the folder in which offline maps are to be stored.

c:geo supports custom themes for offline maps. These can be used to change the color style of the map (e.g. to have a nightview map) or to highlight certain objects like cycle paths or height lines within the map.\n\nWorking with non-zipped map themes might decrease map viewer opening performance. In this case, the theme folder may optionally be synchronized to an app-private local folder for faster access (at the cost of some storage space).
Base folder for public local data
Reminds you every x days for an update check
You may choose to store the additional data for geocaches (spoilers, log images, …) on your external storage (emulated or real external SD card depending on your device).
Set maximum length of history track (enforced on each startup of c:geo). Default value is 700 points - adjust according to available memory.
When activated (and GPS is on) c:geo saves the history of your movements as a track and displays it on the map.
Select color and opaqueness for history track line
Select width for history track line

Select color and opaqueness for direction line. Direction line shows a straight line to your selected navigation target, or the specific routed navigation path, if routing is enabled by installing the BRouter app.

Select color and opaqueness for individual route line. An individual route is a collection of waypoints and/or caches you selected by long-tapping on the waypoint/cache. (You need to enable the long tap function first, see map settings.)
Select width for individual route line
Select color and opaqueness for track/route line. A track/route consists of several waypoints and can be loaded via a GPX track/route file.
Select width for GPX track/route line

Select color and opaqueness for circle line. Circles are used as a visual representation for the minimum radius around a cache or physical waypoint, wherein no other cache or physical waypoint is allowed. (Applies to geocaching.com)
Select color and opaqueness for the circles to be filled with
Select color and opaqueness for accuracy circle line. Accuracy circle is used as a visual representation for location signal accuracy.
Select color and opaqueness for the accuracy circles to be filled with
An offline log counter (e.g. \"+ 1\") will be shown next to your online find count on the home screen if you have logs, that are not submitted yet.
Download directional arrow image if necessary (only required for Basic Members)
Here you can select your preferred navigation tool.
Here you can select your second preferred navigation tool. Activate it by long tapping the navigation icon next to the title of the cache.
Here you can select which of the available navigation methods will be shown in the navigation menu for a cache or waypoint. Disabled tools are not installed on this device.

c:geo can generate a lot of debugging information. Activating this setting will affect the stability of c:geo and is only recommended if you are asked to send a log to the developers. Please keep debug logging disabled during normal usage of c:geo!
You may store the database of c:geo either system internally or into a folder on your user storage. We recommend to only activate this option if you need regular manual access to your database file.
Moving the Geocache data folder partly or completely failed. Please check old and new folders and move missing data by hand.
Identify as Android browser. Solves login problems when using certain network providers.

c:geo stores images and other files related to a cache in a dedicated folder. In some cases (e.g. when importing/exporting the database) this folder may contain obsolete files that can be deleted here.
On devices equipped with Google Play Services, c:geo can automatically use a better geolocation provider. However, this prevents the use of an external BlueTooth GPS receiver.
The low-power mode avoids using the GPS and the gyroscope when a highly accurate location is not strictly necessary, at the cost of longer fixing times.
On some devices, the regular rotation vector sensor behaves erratically, giving the wrong direction. In this case, an alternate sensor (the orientation sensor) may provide better results.

Hardware acceleration renders graphical elements faster on the screen. However on some devices the Android operating system contains bugs and some text may appear blurred (notably bold characters). Disable hardware acceleration if this happens to you.
Use multiple threads to render OpenStreetMap maps
Play a single notification if any cache or waypoint currently visible on the map is closer than far distance or near distance. Different tones are used for the two distances.

Play a repeated notification if the currently selected cache or waypoint is closer than far distance or near distance. Works if cache or waypoint details are opened, cache or waypoint popups on map are shown or compass is active. Different tones are used for the two distances.

Send2cgeo allows you to send caches to your Android device directly from geocaching.com using a special plugin for Firefox or Chrome. Before registering, please see https://send2.cgeo.org/. You only need to register if you want to use send2cgeo. c:geo will work normally without registering your device.
Registration successful. PIN code is %d. Use it on the c:geo website to connect this device to your browser.
c:geo failed to download caches. No internet connection, or send2cgeo is down.
c:geo failed to download caches. Registration for send2cgeo expired. Please register in settings.
The folder %1$s is currently set to \'%2$s\', contains %3$s and %4$s and has a total size of %5$s.
You may choose to use the default folder \'%s\' or pick a user-defined folder.
You selected a different folder than currently stored. The current folder contains %1$s, %2$s and has a size of %3$s. How do you want to proceed?\n\nSelect folder and
File \'%1$s\' in \'%2$s\' could not be created
Files in Folder \'%s\' could not be listed
File \'%1$s\' could not be copied/moved to \'%2$s\' (move=%3$s)
Content of folder %1$s was copied to %2$s.\n\n%3$s of %4$s and %5$s of %6$s were processed.
Content of folder %1$s was moved to %2$s.\n\n%3$s of %4$s and %5$s of %6$s were processed.
The operation failed with code %1$s while processing file %2$s.
Tap \'ok\' to finalize the folder change.
Connected as %s.\nTap here to update or long tap to remove authorization data from c:geo.
The following process will allow c:geo to access %s.
Tapping the \"authorize c:geo\" button will start the process. This process will open up a web browser with a %s page. Log in on this page and allow c:geo to access your account. That\'s all.
You\'ll be disconnected from this service. Your currently saved credentials will be lost.
The following process will allow c:geo to access %s.
If you already have an account please enter your account credentials for %s below:

If you do not yet have an account tap below to be directed to the service\'s webpage to create an account. Make sure to use the method with username and password to create an account as c:geo does not support login via Google/Apple/Facebook. After account creation validation of your email address might be needed before you can use the login with c:geo.
The following process will allow c:geo to access %s.
Filling your credential and tapping the \"authorize c:geo\" button will start the process. This process will connect to %s and retrieve an authentication token. That\'s all.
c:geo is now authorized to post on Twitter.
c:geo is now authorized to interact with %s.
c:geo is now authorized to interact with %s.
Remove all user-defined waypoints of this cache?\n\nWaypoints will be deleted immediately, there is no undo.

Note: You have \"waypoints from note\" enabled. If you have coordinates in your personal note recognized by c:geo, waypoints will be recreated for them automatically. You can disable this in the personal note edit dialog.
Waypoints were added to personal note
Waypoints were added to note but had to be shortened (max personal note size: %1$d)
Waypoints could not be stored in note due to size limits (max personal note size: %1$d)
This personal note will be truncated after %d characters by Geocaching.com.
Description contains table formatting which may need to be viewed at %s to be seen correctly.
This cache is on your watchlist.
This cache is on your watchlist (Watchers: %1d).
This cache is not on your watchlist.
This cache is not on your watchlist (Watchers: %1d).
This cache is one of your favorites.
This cache is not one of your favorites.
Waypoint copied from clipboard to this cache.\n\nRemove original waypoint?
c:geo couldn\'t submit your log cause it is too long. But thanks for trying to write such an extensive log ;-)
Ignoring a cache means that this cache will never occur again when loading data from geocaching.com. You will only be able to see the cache again by unignoring it on the website.
Open WhereYouGo to download and start this cartridge
Install WhereYouGo player to download and start this cartridge
Open Chirp Wolf to read the chirp data for this cache
Install Chirp Wolf to be able to read chirp data
Open Adventure Lab to start playing this adventure
Install Adventure Lab player to play this adventure

This cache stores your recent \"Go to\" targets. It is automatically created once you have used the \"Go to\" function in the main menu. The coordinates entered there will be stored into waypoints of this cache. If you do no longer need these coordinates you can safely delete this cache or any of its waypoints. Also you can move the cache to any other list of your choice.
Activate long tap on map icon (create an individual route) or on free map space (create a user-defined cache)

By long tapping on map you can create individual routes and user-defined caches.

Long tap on map is currently disabled.

You can change this in Settings → Map → Map behavior

By long tapping on map you can create individual routes and user-defined caches.

Long tap on map is currently enabled.

You can change this in Settings → Map → Map behavior
This will delete all historical waypoints except the five most recent
Waiting for new caches from send2cgeo…
Set as cache coordinates in c:geo
Set as cache coordinates in c:geo and on website
Cache coordinates have been reset on website.
Reset in c:geo and on website
Website doesn\'t support modifying cache coordinates.
Error occurred while modifying coordinates on website.
Cache coordinates on website have been modified to: %s.
This will synchronize your themes into an app-private folder to improve map viewer opening performance at the cost of some device storage space.

This will continuously synchronize the content of the Map Theme folder into an app-private folder for faster file access. Make sure your theme folder only contains your themes but no additional (large) data before enabling this feature.

Your map Theme Folder '%1$s' has currently %2$s, %3$s and a size of %4$s.

Do you want to turn on folder synchronization?
Working with non-zipped map themes might decrease map viewer opening performance. You can zip or sync your themes to get faster performance and reduce the delay on starting the map.
Hide original waypoints on the map
Hide parking waypoints on the map
Hide visited waypoints on the map
Live mode is disabled. You will only see stored caches. Use the menu to enable live mode.
Some routing modes are currently not available, as no routing engine is active.\n\nDo you want to activate c:geo\'s internal routing engine and downloading of routing data?
Disable map auto rotation?\n\nYou can enable it again using the Map rotation menu
Some map settings (Map settings, hide, routing) have been moved to the new \"Quick settings\" popup.\nYou can open this popup using the icon in the map\'s bottom center.
The current cache filter is too complex to apply additional options here. Usually this means that the cache filter contains NOT or OR expressions instead of simple AND logic.

**Search by filter** searches caches on all active online services (e.g. geocaching.com) using a provided filter. However, search capabilities of these services are usually more limited than filter capabilities of c:geo.

- All services only support AND filters (no OR filters and no filter inversion).
- The more basic filters like **cache type** or **cache size** are supported by all services. More complicated filters are often not supported or have some restrictions e.g. **favorites** or **hidden date**.
- A detailed list on supported filters per service can be found [here](https://github.com/cgeo/cgeo/wiki/%22Search-by-Filter%22-support-by-c:geo-Connectors).

Filters not supported by the online service will be applied by c:geo on the received results.
c:geo has introduced a new filtering system, supporting flexible, combinable and storable filters. \n\nThe global filter can from now on be changed directly in cache lists and the live map.
All GC geocaches have been added to the selected bookmark list
Failed to add caches to bookmark list
Failed to create a new bookmark list
In the hands of its owner
The event date is in the past. Add it anyway?
Enables you to open a contact card (of your address book) directly from a log entry, so you can more easily ask friends for help.
Send to c:geo is a browser extension for your PC. When browsing geocaching.com, you can send caches to your smartphone with the click of a button directly inside the browser.
Outdoor navigation app for your phone or tablet. View topo maps offline, track your route, hunt geocaches, use a voice guide and do even more.
You can use the radar in this application in conjunction with c:geo. It also offers a lot of other GPS-related information.
Allows you to use an external GPS receiver to get more precise location data, and can spare battery of your device.
GPS Locker keeps GPS signal active when switching between applications and when your device\'s screen is off.
There are Greasemonkey scripts and websites which enable display of geocodes as barcodes. With this app, c:geo can read such geocodes directly from the screen of your computer.

If you download translation packages in the Google Translate app, then you can easily translate cache descriptions in c:geo by a long tap on the cache description text (without an Internet connection).
WhereYouGo allows playing and searching geocaches of type Wherigo. c:geo can automatically trigger the download of cartridges within this app.
BRouter provides offline routing. If it is installed and has the necessary files downloaded, c:geo will automatically show a route to the cache on the internal map.
Chirp Wolf allows you to read the data from ANT+/Garmin chirp tags, which is needed for ANT+/chirp geocaches.
Adventure Lab Player app for your phone or tablet.
Field Notes will be exported to /sdcard/field-notes with the current date and time as their file name.
The GPX file will be exported to %1$s with the current date and time as its file name.
Not a lost and found tour
Access or parking fee not required
Hyperlink to another caching portal only
Not only a hyperlink to another caching portal
Not only available at specified times
Don\'t ask owner for start conditions
Available at specified hours (may require access fee)
Hidden in natural surroundings (forests, mountains, etc.)
Description doesn\'t contain an audio file
Not part of a power trail
To make geocaching easier, to make users lazier.
Should c:geo publish a new status on Twitter every time you log a cache?
New nightly build available.\nTap to install.
New release candidate available.\nTap to install.
Changes on geocaching.com are causing problems in c:geo.\nWe are aware and working on it, please give us some time!
Changes on geocaching.com are causing problems on the live map.\nWe are aware and working on it, please give us some time!
geocaching.com is not (fully) available at the moment.\nYou might experience various problems in c:geo.
You appear to be using an older version of Android. This version of c:geo is no longer compatible with your device and might fail or behave unexpectedly!\nTap on this message for further information.
You are using a version of c:geo which seems to be older than one year. Some features may not work anymore due to website or other technical changes. Please read our FAQ on how to upgrade.
The current language is not supported by text-to-speech.
You want to log \'%s\'. Are you sure?
You want to report \'%s\'. Are you sure?
Authorize c:geo with GeoKrety.org to log GeoKrety trackables.
You\'re about to send a log without a Geocode. It\'s encouraged to set one. Do you want to add it now?

plurals.name: fav_points_remaining

Add this cache to favorites (%d remaining)

Add this cache to favorites (%d remaining)

resources.string: This action may lead to high network traffic. Are you sure you want to batch refresh all caches?
geocaching.com coordinate checker available via browser
Failed to add event cache to calendar
The geocache data folder is running low on storage space. This can cause malfunctions of c:geo. Please free up some space.
c:geo is running in debug mode!
The debug mode causes instabilities! Do you want to deactivate the debug mode?
c:geo needs access to the GPS on your device to locate your position and calculate distance and direction to geocaches. It cannot be used without this permission.

c:geo will write data onto your phone storage or SD card as soon as you save geocaches for offline use. Furthermore c:geo will use your phone storage for import and export of files and reading of offline maps. It cannot be used without this permission.
This function is not possible without storage permission.
Entered value is too small - reset to min value
Entered value is too large - reset to max value
notification is shown while c:geo is doing background work
result notifications for downloads (e.g. offline maps)

Just a few steps are needed to configure c:geo and get you going. Shall I help you with that?
Welcome back to the configuration wizard. Your c:geo setup is not yet finished, shall I help you to complete it and get you going? It\'s just a few steps.
Due to internal changes in the Android permission system I need to ask you for permissions to access certain c:geo data folders. I\'ll guide you through this step by step.
Incomplete configuration\nNot all parts of c:geo will work as expected!
c:geo needs certain permissions on your device to work correctly.\nI will explain more details in the next steps.

c:geo needs a local folder to store data like GPX files, backups, field notes and logfiles. As per default those files are stored in folders beneath a so called "base folder". Select or create such a folder in the next step.

If you upgraded c:geo from a previous version, select the existing folder "cgeo" on root level of your device storage.
Hint: You may need to unhide your device's internal storage first in the file selector being displayed next.
c:geo needs a local folder to store offline map files.
c:geo needs a local folder to store theme files for offline maps.
c:geo needs a local folder to store GPX files (e.g. for importing / exporting caches or tracks).
In order to use the integrated routing tile data auto-download and -update feature you need to set a tile data folder.
Select or create such a folder in the next step.
To find geocaches with c:geo you need an account for a geocaching service supported by c:geo.\nSelect the desired service below to either login with your existing account or create a new account.
This page provides some advanced functions, which are optional to use.\n\nc:geo can download map files for offline usage.
c:geo has an internal routing engine for offline routing and can automatically download missing routing data for you.
If you have a backup of a previous installation you can restore settings and/or geocache data.

c:geo might not work as expected until configuration is completed. Depending on the missing configuration c:geo might not be able to read/store data like offline maps, geocaches, logfiles etc.\n\nWhenever you feel ready to finalize setup, either choose \"Configuration wizard\" in main menu or restart c:geo.
%1$s folder synchronization finished after %2$s, %3$d of %4$s needed synchronization
